author: Staff Reporter
text:
In an alleged robbery bid, two employees of a toll collection company were shot dead by a group of men at their rented accommodation in Badarpur here on Sunday. No arrests have been made so far.

However, despite committing the murders, the suspects got involved in a mix up and ended up decamping with a laptop bag instead of the cash filled bag.

The room in which cashier Manmohan Sharma (60) and gunman Mahipal Singh Yadav (40) were gunned down is one of the five rooms their employers DEP Toll Tax has taken on rent for both official and residential purposes. It is also where the toll collection is parked for short durations.

On Saturday night, the collection agents had collected Rs.63 lakh and deposited the money with Mahipal.

So far the police have zeroed in on Pradeep and Vishal Thakur, two tenants living in the house opposite to the one where the victims stayed, as suspects.

Their friend Sahil is also under the police radar.

An eyewitness in the case, the wife of a Delhi Police Inspector, has claimed to have seen Pradeep and Vishal running away after the incident and neither has surfaced since.

According to local resident Chhavi Kumar, around 7-40 a.m., the purported eyewitness was returning home after buying milk when she heard gunshots and spotted four men leaving the house.
title: Two employees of toll collection firm shot dead
